title: Three killed in shooting at Hiniduma
byline: Three persons have been killed in a shooting incident in the Panangala area in Hiniduma, Galle.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Uva province and in Batticaloa, Ampara, Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts.

title: More details revealed on Hiniduma shooting that killed 3
byline: More information has been revealed about the shooting incident that occurred in the Panangala area of Hiniduma, Galle.

title: Israel releases Palestinian prisoners after delay over chaotic hostage handover
byline: Hamas freed three Israeli and five Thai hostages in Gaza on Thursday and Israel released 110 Palestinian prisoners after delaying the process in anger at the swarming crowds at one of the hostage handover points.

title: Social media contributes to rise in child suicides: CCPSL
byline: The College of Community Physicians of Sri Lanka (CCPSL) states that the use of social media has contributed to an increase in child suicides.

title: President AKD to visit Jaffna today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit the Jaffna District today (31), according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Final report on Beira Lake water contamination to be released today
byline: The National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA) has announced that the final test report on the water samples collected in connection with the recent deaths of animals in Beira Lake will be released today (31).

title: New Zealand mountain gets same legal rights as a person
byline: A settlement under which a New Zealand mountain has been granted the same legal right as a person has become law after years of negotiations.

title: UN Rights Chief launches $500M appeal for global human rights in 2025
byline: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk has launched a US$500 million funding appeal for 2025, to address global human rights needs, according to the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC).

title: UN women’s rights committee to review Sri Lanka
byline: The UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW) will hold its upcoming session from February 3 to 21 to review the status of women’s rights in Sri Lanka, along with seven other countries: Nepal, Belarus, Luxembourg, Belize, Congo, Liechtenstein, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo...

title: Sri Lanka’s Ishadi Amanda crowned 1st Runner-Up at Mrs. World
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ishadi Amanda has etched her name in history by becoming the first runner-up at the 40th Mrs. World pageant held in Las Vegas, USA.

title: Sri Lanka’s Ishadi Amanda crowned 1st Runner-Up at Mrs. World
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ishadi Amanda has etched her name in history by becoming the first runner-up at the 40th Mrs. World pageant held in Las Vegas, USA.

title: Chairman of National Housing Development Authority resigns
byline: The Chairman of the National Housing Development Authority (NHDA), N.B.M. Ranatunga has resigned from his position.

title: ADB to help Sri Lanka further boost tourism sector
byline: The Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake, had a meeting with representatives from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) yesterday (30) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Over 3,000 Sri Lankans among illegal immigrants to be deported from US
byline: The U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has revealed that 3,065 Sri Lankans are among the over 1.4 million illegal immigrants slated for deportation under the new Trump administration.

title: Train services disrupted on upcountry line
byline: The train services on the railway track between Hatton and Kotagala on the Upcountry Railway Line have been disrupted due to a mound of earth and a tree collapsing onto the tracks.

title: Italy’s regulator blocks Chinese AI app DeepSeek on data protection
byline: Italy’s data protection authority said on Thursday it had blocked Chinese artificial intelligence model DeepSeek over a lack of information on its use of personal data.

title: President pays last respects to former MP Mavai Senathirajah
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake paid his final respects to the late former Parliamentarian and senior leader of the Ilankai Thamil Arasu Katchchi (ITAK), Mavai Senathirajah.

title: President Anura Kumara vows to return land to rightful owners in North
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that land belonging to the people should rightfully remain with them.

title: Sri Lanka to designate special day to celebrate ethnic cultures and traditions
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has announced that a special day will be designated in October to celebrate the cultures, traditions, and values of all ethnicities in Sri Lanka.

title: Colombo’s inflation drops to -4% in January
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has decreased to -4% in January 2025, compared to -1.7% in December 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Chairman of National Youth Services Council resigns
byline: Chinthaka Darshana Hewapathirana has resigned as the Chairman of the National Youth Services Council (NYSC).

title: Three Israeli hostages, including dual US citizen, set for release in Gaza on Saturday
byline: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Friday it would free the father of the youngest hostages seized in its Oct. 7, 2023 attack on Israel and two others including a dual U.S. citizen in the next exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners.

title: Price of Super Diesel increased
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has revised a fuel price with effect from midnight today (31). MORE…

title: US opens doors for Sri Lankan apparel manufacturers to set up operations
byline: The U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, states that the U.S. apparel manufacturing sector is projected to generate USD 365 billion in revenue in 2025 and added that Sri Lanka can benefit from reduced shipping times, lower tariffs, and the ability to respond swiftly to market demands by establishing operations in the United States.

title: Medirigiriya OIC arrested for sexual harassment of WPC
byline: The Officer-in-Charge of the Medirigiriya Police Station has been arrested by the ‘Bureau for the Investigation of Abuse of Children and Women’ for allegedly sexually harassing a Woman Police Constable (WPC), the police said.

title: Gazette issued lifting suspension on vehicle imports to Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, has issued an Extraordinary Gazette notification today (31), officially lifting the temporary suspension imposed on vehicle imports to Sri Lanka.
